channel.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories
channel.description: Top stories in the U.S. and world news, politics, health, science, business, music, arts and culture. Nonprofit journalism with a mission. This is NPR.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

image.title: NPR Topics: Home Page Top Stories

item.title: Trump says he doesn't want Somalis in the U.S., urges them to go back to their homeland and fix it
item.description: President Trump says he doesn't want Somali immigrants in the U.S., saying residents of the war-ravaged eastern African country are too reliant on U.S. social safety net and add little to the U.S.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump says he doesn't want Somali immigrants in the U.S., saying residents of the war-ravaged eastern African country are too reliant on U.S. social safety net and add little to the U.S.

(Image credit: Julia Demaree Nikhinson)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: White House justifies strikes on boat survivors, but it's unclear where buck stops
item.description: In the face of charges that these strikes amount to execution without trial, the White House is sending a confusing message about who exactly gave each order to use deadly force.
item.content:encoded:
In the face of charges that these strikes amount to execution without trial, the White House is sending a confusing message about who exactly gave each order to use deadly force.

(Image credit: Chip Somodevilla)
item.dc:creator: Quil Lawrence

item.title: Michael and Susan Dell commit $6.25 billion for investment accounts for kids
item.description: Michael and Susan Dell are donating $6.25 billion to fund "Trump Accounts" for 25 million U.S. children. The gift would put $250 into each eligible child's account.
item.content:encoded:
Michael and Susan Dell are donating $6.25 billion to fund "Trump Accounts" for 25 million U.S. children. The gift would put $250 into each eligible child's account.

(Image credit: Frank Franklin II)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: The defining cultural trends of 2025, according to YouTube
item.description: A 1960s pop song, a must-have soft toy and a global anime hit are among the leaders on YouTube's year-end trends list.
item.content:encoded:
A 1960s pop song, a must-have soft toy and a global anime hit are among the leaders on YouTube's year-end trends list.

(Image credit: ©2025 Netflix)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Costco sues the Trump administration over tariffs, joining a refund queue
item.description: Costco is one of the largest companies to sue for possible refunds if the Supreme Court strikes down the new import duties.
item.content:encoded:
Costco is one of the largest companies to sue for possible refunds if the Supreme Court strikes down the new import duties.

(Image credit: David Zalubowski)
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: What song hit you hard in 2025?
item.description: Send us a voice memo about a song that hit you hard in 2025 — one you listened to on repeat, made you cry, or just got you in your feels like no other.
item.content:encoded:
Send us a voice memo about a song that hit you hard in 2025 — one you listened to on repeat, made you cry, or just got you in your feels like no other.

(Image credit: Catherine LoMedico)
item.dc:creator: Robin Hilton

item.title: A major winter storm is pummeling the Northeast with ice and snow
item.description: A system expected to drop 6 inches of snow or more from Pennsylvania to Maine could tie up the Tuesday evening commute, the National Weather Service says.
item.content:encoded:
A system expected to drop 6 inches of snow or more from Pennsylvania to Maine could tie up the Tuesday evening commute, the National Weather Service says.

(Image credit: Matt Rourke)
item.dc:creator: Joe Hernandez

item.title: Photojournalist Lynsey Addario on balancing work and family — when work is a war zone
item.description: The Pulitzer Prize-winning photojournalist has been kidnapped and thrown from a car. Still, Addario says, parenting two young kids can be more challenging than war reporting.
item.content:encoded:
The Pulitzer Prize-winning photojournalist has been kidnapped and thrown from a car. Still, Addario says, parenting two young kids can be more challenging than war reporting.

(Image credit: Caitlin Kelly)
item.dc:creator: Sam Fragoso

item.title: A dying woman chooses friends over her husband in 'Some Bright Nowhere'
item.description: A woman with a terminal diagnosis asks her husband to leave the house in Ann Packer's new novel. Some Bright Nowhere is an absorbing book about end-of-life care and what the living owe the dying.
item.content:encoded: A woman with a terminal diagnosis asks her husband to leave the house in Ann Packer's new novel. Some Bright Nowhere is an absorbing book about end-of-life care and what the living owe the dying.
item.dc:creator: Maureen Corrigan

item.title: Trump pardons Honduran ex-president who was convicted of drug crimes
item.description: President Trump has officially pardoned former Honduran President who US officials said was at the center of one of the largest and most violent drug-trafficking conspiracies in the world.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump has officially pardoned former Honduran President who US officials said was at the center of one of the largest and most violent drug-trafficking conspiracies in the world.

(Image credit: Marlon Gomez/CON)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez
